before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fa2u","text":"Be sure to have your intended material (plasmid/DNA) to be transformed ready and quantified, as well as all media that you will need for successful completion.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jcn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nhfo","text":"The 10% glycerol used in this protocol should be sterilized by filtration using a .22µm filter, and any water used should be PCR grade sterile water.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l016","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38sn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Christina M. Ferreira
creator.affiliation: U.S. Food and Drug Administration, College Park, MD

affiliations.affiliation: U.S. Food and Drug Administration, College Park, MD

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4a7c2","text":"Protocol for generating electrocompetent Salmonella cells and transforming them in less than 1-day, with a high transformation efficiency. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":41,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2t525","text":"In a 125mL Erlenmeyer flask containing 25mL of fresh TSB, transfer 1mL of the overnight culture (1:25 dilution) and incubate at 35°C±2°C, without shaking for 3 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":138,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajc5o","text":"Before the end of the incubation, pre-warm SOC (measured into 1ml microcentrifuge tubes) at 35°C. You will need to make enough 1ml aliquots of SOC for the total number of transformations you plan to do plus 1 for a negative control (1 transformation = 1ml of culture).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpkbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ctog","text":"Additionally, place sterile water, filter sterilized 10% glycerol and electroporation cuvettes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2otb","text":"Harvest 1mL of your 3-hour culture into microcentrifuge tubes for every transformation you intend to perform plus one additional aliquot for a negative control.  Pellet the cells by centrifugation at 13,200rpm for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"806h1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adqa9","text":"Resuspend the cell pellet in 1ml of cold sterile water by pipetting gently up and down, making sure not to create any bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":68,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23ptb","text":"Resuspend the cell pellet in 1ml of cold, sterile 10% glycerol by pipetting gently up and down, making sure not to create any bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7efce","text":"Resuspend pellet in 50µl cold sterile 10% glycerol by pipetting gently up and down, making sure not to create any bubbles (50-70µl cell slurry final volume). Immediately place the cell suspension on ice and allow it to remain there for up to 4 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":158,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aur5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jrfn","text":"NOTE: Though not advisable, it is possible to freeze the cell suspension at -80°C at this point to use the cells later.  The transformation efficiency will not be as robust compared to that of the freshly prepped cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"154nr","text":"Add the appropriate amount of DNA (Table 1) to your prepped cell suspension using a micropipettor, and mix by gently swirling with your pipet tip. Incubate on ice for 3-5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"823rl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fntfi","text":"            ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh20j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eli9l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["  ","[DNA]ng"],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Plasmid","100"],["dsDNA","100"]],"guid":"FFF95230935B11ED9C294DF7EA643BA1","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8avve","text":"Table 1: Amont of genetic material to mix with your competent cells. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Plasmid","100"],["dsDNA","100"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mfrl","text":"Transfer the entire cell/DNA slurry to a pre-chilled electroporation cuvette using a P100/200 by pipetting slowly down the side(making sure not to create any bubbles) and then tapping to move cell mixture to bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crjng","text":"Electroporate, using the parameters below, for the size cuvette you are using, and immediately add 1ml of pre-warmed SOC to move electroporated cells from the cuvette to the SOC microfuge tube. Incubate at 35°C±2°C (heat block/incubator) for 1 hour, at minimum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":83,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gbp3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19v3q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2p8os","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98g4n","text":"NOTE: Please adapt temperature at which you are incubating for any heat sensitive genes or plasmids you are adding or have added into the strain.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cup19","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9elev","text":"NOTE: Recovery time is 1 hour minimum, please adapt for your downstream application in the case of chromosomal insertions which may require more time to complete the recombination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99r5f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Cuvette Size","Volts","Resistance"],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["0.1 cm","1.8 kV","200"],["0.2 cm","2.5 kV","200"]],"guid":"618B0890B6DE11EDB6748F2F4BCB9448","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["0.1 cm","1.8 kV","200"],["0.2 cm","2.5 kV","200"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evmsp","text":"Without vortexing the recovery but mixing by flicking, spread plate 50µl – 100µl onto LBA or TSA plates containing your selective compound and incubate overnight at 35°C±2°C for 20-24 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3oaru","text":"Inoculate 2ml of Tryptic-Soy Broth (TSB) with a single colony of your strain from your overnight TSA plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1: Preparation of the target strain(s) from -80°C
Day 1: Preparation of the target strain(s) from -80°C
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8njr9","text":"Isolating for single colonies, plate your Salmonella strain onto Tryptic-Soy Agar(TSA). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":42,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2q8ps","text":"Discard the supernatant by pouring and then remove any excess with a 200µl pipettor.  Immediately place cells on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vure","text":"Discard the supernatant by pouring and then remove any excess with a 200µl pipettor.  Immediately place cells on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag3h4","text":"Discard the supernatant by pouring and then remove any excess with a 200µl pipettor.  Immediately place cells on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Salmonella Quick Electroporation Protocol

creator.name: Christina M. Ferreira
creator.affiliation: U.S. Food and Drug Administration, College Park, MD
